definition: rifling (helical grooves inside the barrel of a gun)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Such rifles could not be loaded as rapidly as smoothbore muskets.
sentences.chinese: 它们不能像无膛线步枪那样迅速填装弹药。

sentences.english: A New Method for Measuring the Rifling Angle of Artillery Pipe Based on Template Matching .
sentences.chinese: 基于模板匹配的火炮身管膛线缠角测量技术研究。

sentences.english: BULLET a shaped projectile designed to be shot trough the rifled barrel of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 设计成一定形状的射弹，通过制有膛线的枪管发射。

sentences.english: Rifled firearms date at least to the 15th century.
sentences.chinese: 有膛线的武器最早可以追溯到15世纪。

sentences.english: It was rare, she said, rifling through a patient's tattered record.
sentences.chinese: 这是少有的，她说，通过病人的破烂的纪录膛线。

sentences.english: The patterns for a projectile traveling in the ideal increasing twist bore are studied.
sentences.chinese: 求解了非对称弹丸在渐速膛线理想身管内的运动规律。

sentences.english: Relationship between rotation and translation of the projectile is determined by the pitch of the rifling.
sentences.chinese: 弹丸可有偏心，其转动和平动的关系由膛线缠角确定。

sentences.english: New Method for Measuring the Rifling Angle of Artillery Pipe Based on Template Matching .
sentences.chinese: 基于模板匹配的火炮身管膛线缠角测量技术研究。

definition: rifling (spiral lines on inside of gun barrel imparting spin to the bullet)
rifling (helical grooves inside the barrel of a gun)
